Luminary:
A person who inspires or influences others, especially one prominent in a particular sphere.
In the center of Fort Myers sits more than just a hotel. It’s a hub where countless stories of creative pioneers come together to enlighten locals and travelers while inspiring them to new adventures of their own. Luminary Hotel & Co. is the beating heart of the city where you can become part of a storyline that’s always being written.
Quirky Characters
The banks of the Caloosahatchee have seen the arrival of countless individuals looking to explore the possibilities of Fort Myers. There are so many inspiring and entertaining stories surrounding the luminaries who built Fort Myers. Some of their contributions are captured in these fanciful illustrations brought to life by local artist
Joshua Noom
. Look closely, there are unexpected plot twists and cameo appearances!
The Caloosahatchee
The river and its inhabitants are such a crucial part of the area’s historical landscape. To this day, its gentle current evokes an appreciation for taking your time to enjoy where you are just as much as where you are going.
Capt. Francis A. Hendry
Ask any local of Fort Myers and they’re bound to know about the Hendry family. The patriarch came to the area by way of a cattle drive (and war), and established a home. His charisma quickly made him an influential member of the town.
Alice McCann
From her switchboard above the Heitman General Store, Alice became the first telephone operator in Fort Myers. Her penchant for exchanging more than just phone lines also made her the woman who heard and shared everything — and we mean everything.
Tootie McGregor
While her nickname is something of a mystery, Tootie’s legacy can be felt on every road — literally. With an eye for business and a generous heart, she worked behind the scenes to invest in the beautification and paving of her beloved town. Today, she is known as the ‘Mother of Fort Myers.’

Across the Spectrum
Exceptional moments arise when given the right atmosphere. Designed to inspire and engage, our spaces accommodate groups ranging from 10 to 3,000 attendees. Consider us the laboratory where your plans and ideas can take flight.
Request a Proposal
Venues & Capacities
Virtual Tour
Hotel Spaces
The heartbeat of the hotel is embodied by The Workshop, a 2,300 square foot culinary theater with stadium seating and the latest in audio visual. Our fourth-floor features six meeting rooms which spill out onto the pool and event deck, overlooking the Caloosahatchee. Opt for the non-traditional route and host a breakfast or lunch on the rooftop at Beacon. For a more private affair, your guests will appreciate the ambiance in Silver King’s private dining room. Your on-site event manager will oversee every detail along the way, including marketing materials, board site selection meetings, menu tastings and more.
Caloosa Sound Convention Center & Amphitheater
Soaring ceilings, grand spaces and flexible configurations highlight the significant renovations and upgrades. The 30,000 square foot Caloosa Sound Ballroom with generous pre-function areas lends itself to showstopping general sessions, elegant receptions and convenient breakouts. To add a touch of drama, the outdoor amphitheater and park provides the perfect setting for a private concert, spontaneous team building or closing rally for your troops.
Caloosa Sound Convention Center
Caloosa Sound Amphitheater
Oxbow Bar & Grill
Just steps away from our front door on the banks of the Caloosahatchee, lies Oxbow’s unique second floor event space offering sweeping views of the river. With expansive windows and a spacious outdoor terrace, immersing your guests in Authentic Florida has never been this delightful. Its capabilities are endless ranging from a welcome reception, rehearsal dinner, sunset celebration, bridal brunch or our meeting space with the best views. A choice destination for orchestrated downtown dine arounds.
Private Events
